result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi L Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: 14-CF-468.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond on file shall be applied to amounts due. Balance to be transferred to 14-CF-468 for payment of amounts due in that case.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with any Washington County Walmart or St. Vincent de Paul stores.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by her supervising agent. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant shall advise her supervising agent within 48 hours of being prescribed any medications.
Defendant shall advise her health care providers of her addiction history.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
